page.title: 02Landscape - General
page.content: The prevailing impression is of a green, flourishing landscape, with areas of woodland and orchards viewed across fields of pasture or arable, which are themselves bounded by hedgerows. The west half of the block has wider stretches of woodland than the east, but trees are visible from any point, especially as they are a feature of the hedgerows too.Where bare earth is to be seen, its red colour adds to the impression of richness. The undulating landscape rises above 500ft at one point only, with the result that the rim of the more distant hills can be glimpsed all round. Roads, however, are winding and narrow, so that the immediate view is often blocked at road level by the hedgerows - even when trimmed.
